meanings.definition: Of or relating to a phylum.
meanings.sent1: The phylar characteristics of the animals helped scientists classify them.
meanings.sent2: The phylar differences between the two species were fascinating to study.
meanings.sent3: The phylar similarities between the plants made them easy to group together.
meanings.sent4: The phylar structure of the organism resembled that of ancient creatures.
meanings.sent5: The phylar features of the fish made it stand out among its peers.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms classified together based on shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The phylar of birds includes various species like eagles and sparrows.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the phylar of insects to understand their evolutionary history.
meanings.sent3: The phylar of mammals gathered for a meeting to discuss their habitats.
meanings.sent4: The phylar of plants in the garden created a beautiful ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the phylar of marine life revealed a diverse range of creatures.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the classification of organisms into phyla.
meanings.sent1: The phylar system helped biologists organize different species efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the phylar relationships between organisms is crucial for taxonomy.
meanings.sent3: The phylar approach to grouping organisms simplified the study of biodiversity.
meanings.sent4: The phylar analysis of insects revealed surprising evolutionary connections.
meanings.sent5: The phylar classification of plants made it easier to identify their characteristics.
